Description: Sherd from lid of a Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior: reserved; exterior: black-figure (very worn) decoration consisting of lion to right (mane and shoulder remaining; added red on shoulder and mane).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit identifies the sherd as coming from a pyxis lid but the shape is not typical for this Chian style.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 38, no. 139, pl. 34)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 316, no. 1360a, pl. 175)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2102) (phase 2)
